newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends at highs on short-covering rally.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends at highs on short-covering rally.

text.p: WCE canola futures ended at the day's highs on a short covering rally spurred by a late upward surge in CBOT soycomplex futures, traders said.

"Commercials were bull spreading, locals and commission houses were short covering on the rally in Chicago," a trader said. Nov-Jan spread at $4, Mar-July even, Jan-Mar $2, Nov-Mar $6, Mar-May $2.30, May-July $1.50. November crush margin fell to -39.79 from -38.08 on Monday. Volume was 10,900 lots.
Japan bought 1,000 tonnes cash canola overnight, sources said.
Nover=mber canola rose $5.10 to $404.40, January up $3.60 to $408. November flax fell $1.50 to $367.50 on hedges.
Flax volume was 276 lots. Nov-Jan at $2.50.
October feed wha=eat rose the $5 limit to $181.90, December rose $4.80 to $174.10 with Louis Dreyfus and Midland Walwyn buying from Cargill, traders said. Oct-Dec spread at $6.
November barley rose $1.10 in sympathy with feed wheat to $147.40 on commercial and commission short covering. Nov-Feb spread $2, Feb-Mar $0.20. Peas didn't trade.
December oats lost US$0.10 to US$131.90 on commission selling.
(All valuesin Canadian dollars except peas, oats.)
